thread.title: TransIndus creates bespoke Southeast Asia programme
thread.title_full: TransIndus creates bespoke Southeast Asia programme

title: TransIndus creates bespoke Southeast Asia programme
text:
TransIndus creates bespoke Southeast Asia programme 6 August 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
﻿TransIndus has launched its new Southeast Asia Tailor-Made brochure complete with 24 new tours. 
Managing director Amrit Singh said it was the first tailor-made brochure dedicated solely to the region that the operator had put out in four years. 
She is hoping the brochure will inspire customers, who can also create their own personal trips from the programme. 
Singh said: “These are tailor-made brochures. We produce the group tours brochure each year and only when we feel we’ve got quality to add do we produce a [tailor-made] brochure. 
“We don’t publish brochures every year, preferring instead to create something really special, compiled by professional travel writers and our own destination experts, that our clients will want to keep over time. 
“It’s more like a richly illustrated guide book; a comprehensive tool that will help our clients to plan their dream trip.” 
The programme covers Myanmar, Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos, Thailand, Malaysia, Singapore and Indonesia and also has a focus on available experiences for the first time. 
Singh said: “Our clients want to engage in doing things rather than just going out and seeing a place.” 
Prices lead in at £1,390 for the 10-day Classic Cambodia trip, which includes return flights, seven nights’ B&B accommodation and all internal entry fees and transportation.
